summary: Investigating and fixing backend connection/startup failures caused by missing authorization modules; rebuilding authorization folder so the backend can run.
known_issues: Backend depends on missing/empty authorization modules (backend/authorization/access-control.mo and backend/authorization/MixinAuthorization.mo), causing permission checks/init to fail and canister to be unreachable.

new_feature_requests.summary: Recreate/restore missing backend authorization modules (access-control.mo, MixinAuthorization.mo) to resolve canister startup/connectivity issues

Recreate the missing Motoko authorization module at `backend/authorization/access-control.mo` so that `backend/main.mo` can compile and the canister can start. The module must provide a non-trapping `initState()` function and the permission-checking functions used by `backend/main.mo` (at minimum: `hasPermission(state, caller, role)` and `isAdmin(state, caller)`), supporting the role tags referenced in `backend/main.mo` (`#admin` and `#user`).

Recreate the missing Motoko authorization mixin at `backend/authorization/MixinAuthorization.mo` so that `backend/main.mo` can compile and include it (`include MixinAuthorization(accessControlState);`). The mixin must accept the access control state created by `AccessControl.initState()` and must not trap during actor initialization. Any public/shared/query methods exported by the mixin must be safe to call and must not require unavailable dependencies.

projectName: Restore missing backend authorization modules to fix canister startup/connectivity
